description: The Hydra Core Vocabulary is a lightweight vocabulary to create hypermedia-driven Web APIs. By specifying a number of concepts commonly used in Web APIs it enables the creation of generic API clients.
label: The Hydra Core Vocabulary

Resource.description: The class of dereferenceable resources by means a client can attempt to dereference; however, the received responses should still be verified.
Resource.label: Hydra Resource

BaseUriSource.description: Provides a base abstract for base Uri source for Iri template resolution.
BaseUriSource.label: Base Uri source

VariableRepresentation.description: A representation specifies how to serialize variable values into strings.
VariableRepresentation.label: VariableRepresentation

Collection.description: A collection holding references to a number of related resources.
Collection.label: Collection

Error.description: A runtime error, used to report information beyond the returned status code.
Error.label: Error

Status.description: Additional information about a status code that might be returned.
Status.label: Status code description

IriTemplateMapping.description: A mapping from an IRI template variable to a property.
IriTemplateMapping.label: IriTemplateMapping

Link.description: The class of properties representing links.
Link.label: Link

PartialCollectionView.description: A PartialCollectionView describes a partial view of a Collection. Multiple PartialCollectionViews can be connected with the the next/previous properties to allow a client to retrieve all members of the collection.
PartialCollectionView.label: PartialCollectionView

SupportedProperty.description: A property known to be supported by a Hydra class.
SupportedProperty.label: Supported Property

HeaderSpecification.description: Specifies a possible either expected or returned header values
HeaderSpecification.label: Header specification

apiDocumentation.description: A link to the API documentation
apiDocumentation.label: apiDocumentation

collection.description: Collections somehow related to this resource.
collection.label: collection

entrypoint.description: A link to main entry point of the Web API
entrypoint.label: entrypoint

expects.description: The information expected by the Web API.
expects.label: expects

first.description: The first resource of an interlinked set of resources.
first.label: first

last.description: The last resource of an interlinked set of resources.
last.label: last

next.description: The resource following the current instance in an interlinked set of resources.
next.label: next

operation.description: An operation supported by the Hydra resource
operation.label: operation

possibleStatus.description: A status that might be returned by the Web API (other statuses should be expected and properly handled as well)
possibleStatus.label: possible status

previous.description: The resource preceding the current instance in an interlinked set of resources.
previous.label: previous

returns.description: The information returned by the Web API on success
returns.label: returns

supportedClass.description: A class known to be supported by the Web API
supportedClass.label: supported classes

supportedOperation.description: An operation supported by instances of the specific Hydra class, or the target of the Hydra link, or IRI template.
supportedOperation.label: supported operation

supportedProperty.description: The properties known to be supported by a Hydra class
supportedProperty.label: supported properties

view.description: A specific view of a resource.
view.label: view

closedSet.description: Determines whether the provided set of header values is closed or not.
closedSet.label: closed set

expectsHeader.description: Specification of the header expected by the operation.
expectsHeader.label: expects header

extension.description: Hint on what kind of extensions are in use.
extension.label: extension

freetextQuery.description: A property representing a freetext query.
freetextQuery.label: freetext query

limit.description: Instructs to limit set only to N elements.
limit.label: take

mapping.description: A variable-to-property mapping of the IRI template.
mapping.label: mapping

offset.description: Instructs to skip N elements of the set.
offset.label: skip

pageIndex.description: Instructs to provide a specific page of the collection at a given index.
pageIndex.label: page index

pageReference.description: Instructs to provide a specific page reference of the collection.
pageReference.label: page reference

readable.description: True if the client can retrieve the property's value, false otherwise.
readable.label: readable

required.description: True if the property is required, false otherwise.
required.label: required

returnsHeader.description: Name of the header returned by the operation.
returnsHeader.label: returns header

statusCode.description: The HTTP status code. Please note it may happen this value will be different to actual status code received.
statusCode.label: status code

template.description: A templated string with placeholders. The literal's datatype indicates the template syntax; if not specified, hydra:Rfc6570Template is assumed.
template.label: template

title.description: A title, often used along with a description.
title.label: title

totalItems.description: The total number of items referenced by a collection.
totalItems.label: total items

variableRepresentation.description: The representation format to use when expanding the IRI template.
variableRepresentation.label: variable representation

writable.description: True if the client can change the property's value, false otherwise.
writable.label: writable

search.description: A IRI template that can be used to query a collection.
search.label: search
